review.reviewBody: I love these. I have (too) many pairs of Salomon shoes, each with there own agenda. These have been butting in to everyone else's business and taking over as a one shoe fits all tasks.
review.name: Warm, secure, and dry!

review.reviewBody: I have purchased about 10 pairs of XA Pro 3D. Insanely solid shoe that is water proof to the end of days. I bought a pair of the V9 last year and they are so incredibly narrow. Can’t wear them. Bought Gore ASICS and they leaked out of the gate. These new shoes fit like the older versions and so far are waterproof. I am hopeful the new tech will keep them that way.
review.name: Good alternative to the XA Pro 3D

review.reviewBody: Good fit, a versatile shoe for hiking.  Would but buy again.
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody:
This has been a very great shoe, I purchased in May of 2024 and took it right to my first Spartan Canada event for the year. Since than I have a recording of 700km plus with an additional 200-250km before the end of 2024 with them. The lace design has held up excellent and has always kept my foot in the shoe excellent. Material of the shoe has last excellent with no tears or cracking, even with all the abuse I have put them through. (Rock, mud, sand, water) Spartan racing is really hard on the foot and the shoe and this shoe hasn't let me down yet. 
I have however lost a decent amount of tread on the one shoe around the top of the foot (see last Pic) but I don't hold this against the shoe with the distance and abuse I have put these through.
Overall I'm sold and will be getting another pair of Solomon (Cross 6) for the new year 2025 of trail racing anyone with the 4 kids who all do the same.
review.name: Amazing Durability

review.reviewBody: I bought the shoes about 3 weeks ago.  Shoelaces broke on day 2 otherwise the shoes were great
review.name: Great shoe poor shoelaces
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: Got my father a black pair, size 8.5 and it fit him perfectly. He described as a gentle hug around the feet, good cushioning and light. While he hasn't had the chance of wearing it on the trails yet, he's been wearing it for hours in the house and almost forgot to take it off when he was going to take a nap on the sofa.
review.name: Like a gentle hug around the feet

review.reviewBody: These shoes were comfortable right out of the box. I now have two (2) pairs in different colours that I alternate to wear to work. Great shoes!
review.name: Very Good Shoes

review.reviewBody: I needed a shoe for walking the dog. We live in a city coastal environment that is humid and wet most of the year with easy access to trails and forested areas. The shoe I was looking for had to be waterproof and have excellent grip for walking on loose, wet, or uneven surfaces. I also have a wide foot and constant trouble finding extra wide shoes. This shoe fitted my Roman style extra wide foot straight out the box. If your looking for a shoe with similiar needs as mine, then I would recommend giving it some thought and trying it on when you're in search for another shoe. Happy Trails
review.name: Excellent grip on loose, wet, uneven surfaces.

review.reviewBody: Its a good shoe, the lacing system is easy to use and makes taking them on and off fast.
review.name: Nice hiking shoe/Sneaker

review.reviewBody: Love the speed laces, quality of shoe and water “proofness”. Have been trying for quite a long time to replace NUMEROUS pairs of the Ultra X 3 Hiking Shoe and thought I had finally done it. Alas, what began as a “little tight” in the toes became an unwearable pair of shoes, especially when going downhill.  These shoe are sneakily NARROW in the toes. Too bad, the rest would have worked! Ultra X 4 are NOT the the 3’s either, nor are the several other pairs of Salomon’s I have tried.  Time to move on …
review.name: REALLY Wanted to Like These

name: X Ultra 360 CSWP Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: The design of these shorts is very good. I can tell there was thought out into them. My main dislike is the nylon-like material they are made out of. While they seem like they would be cool to wear, I was not confident they would hold up to rubbing up against small branches and bushes. I feel this type of material is better suited for casual hybrid bike riding not mtb. I returned the product. Also, my waist size fell in between a size L and. XL. After trying them in I feel a size XL would have suited me better. The size L would have worked, but I would prefer just a little more overall room. If you decide to purchase, make sure you select the correct inseam length. I must have overlooked this and the shorts I purchased were mid thigh length. Way too short for mountain biking. I don't understand why this size is even available for mountain biking!
review.name: Did not like the material

review.reviewBody:
These are great shorts; well-made, lots of pockets, and durable (took a nasty spill and they came away unscathed). I also love the adjustable waist for when I have had a few too many beers. As a lifelong roadie who recently got into mountain biking, I am a big fan of the 9" inseam length which is perfect for keeping the shorts out of the way while pedaling and also not looking ridiculous while off the bike :-) My only issue with them is that they are a bit heavy; would have been a perfect 5-stars if they were a bit lighter. 

I used my actual measurements for waist and hip and they fit true to size. Overall, highly recommended if you are looking for some stylish shorts that won't break the budget!
review.name: Almost perfect

name: Ether 9 Short - Men's

hasVariant.name: Singi Padded Vest - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Singi Padded Vest - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought this item 3 months ago and have worn it daily over the British summer! Found it to be a great vest/jacket - light to wear but highly windproof and roomy enough for another layer on top of base layer as and when required. Hand pockets are very generous size and quality build of jacket means heavier items in pocket/s means you don’t feel ‘weighed down’ on one side/lopsided. Have not applied wax for winter weather yet but will do so in coming months. Really like the plain simple style as, personally I’m not a fan of quilted designs. Inner zipped security pocket is also useful.
review.name: Simple/plain waistcoat that looks and does the job

review.reviewBody: At 5'8" and 170lbs the Fjällräven Singi Padded Vest in medium fits true to size and is the perfect layering piece over a hoodie, flannel, or even a t-shirt. The padded insulation provides just enough warmth when needed. The chest pockets are great for a Field Notes or your cell phone. It's a functional & stylish piece you're sure to get compliments on.
review.name: Daily Driver

name: Singi Padded Vest - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I've been riding Pivot 18s for 10+ years. They have been exactly what I need as a freerider. High performance, reliable, durable. 

I ordered the Pivot 15s in Silver for my next all around ski (115 width) and they came dirty and scratched up in the box. Both toe pieces have the exact same defect. Not sure if its just a sloppy paint job or a defect in their mold. Highly disappointed. I expect more from Look.

Will likely be returning these and moving to Marker!
review.name: Long time Pivot rider, somethings wrong

review.reviewBody: Big fan of these bindings in the past, but kinda disappointed how scratched up the came out of the box given the price point.
review.name: Great bindings, but came scratched up

review.reviewBody: I switched back to Look after many years and so happy that I did. Super easy to click in, ultra confident when ripping turns and all metal construction makes it a no brainer for buying these bad boys and mounting them to your favorite skis. Forza 3.0 color scheme let’s everyone know you mean business.
review.name: Click in and don’t LOOK back

review.reviewBody: I am a freeride skier and compete in freeride events. These bindings allow me to push my riding and ski aggressively with no fear. There is so much comfort in knowing the heel pivots which can help prevent serious injuries. I have so much confidence in these bindings. I wouldn’t ski in any other binding. They never pre-release and always pop off when I need them to.
review.name: They make me feel fearless

review.reviewBody:
I only use Pivot bindings now.
I ski with them on 9.5 din but with all other bindings I have to be at 12 or 13 to stay in, so these always release when I needed and have never pre released.
I raced World cup and have been a professional skier ( teacher and trainer) for 40 years; my knees are in great shape and a lot of that is due to these bindings !
review.name: Safest binding on the market

review.reviewBody: There is no other binding for me.  Simply the best.
review.name: Gold standard

review.reviewBody: I've had these bindings for the entirety of my time freestyle skiing and I will have them until I can't ski any more. Due to the ability for the backs of these bindings to rotate 360 degrees, when taking a crash that twists your ankle or knee the back bindings follows the twist and saves you from breaking or over twisting your limbs. Life saver.
review.name: Ankle Savers

review.reviewBody:
the best resort binding for aggressive skiers.  park, powder, bumps, goin fast, whatever.  Predictable release, lowest stack height of any binding on the market, all metal 15s will last literally forever.  

if you're new to pivots and curious on brake sizing, the listed width is really much wider.  in my experience with a little bending 95mm brake will be good for up to ~105mm, 115mm brake good for up to ~125mm
review.name: Won't catch me skiing anything else

review.reviewBody: The best binding bar none - quality craftsmanship and outstanding customer service
review.name: Pivot Gold 15

review.reviewBody: Super pumped to have the 15din pivot back.  I love the metal toe design, but I was never really psyched on barely being on the spring on the 18din version.  Now I can be in the middle of the spring on the best bindings on the market!  And the gold looks pretty baller on the new M-Pros!
review.name: A realisitc DIN range

name: Pivot 15 GW Ski Binding - 2025
Pivot 15 GW Ski Binding | GH Review

review.reviewBody: Ordered size medium for my son, 14yrs, 5’-7”, 145lbs, fit perfectly and he likes the fabric and quality. We plan to order another in a different color.
review.name: Great Fit, Good Quality and Material

review.reviewBody: Fits great. The flannel material is super quality and the stitching is on point.
review.name: Good fit, Quality material

review.reviewBody:
This shirt is mighty comfortable.  So much so that you could sleep in it.  The fit is good for me as well.  Typically, XXL shirts have a tendency to have a parachute quality to them, but this shirt has a tailored fit.  Nevertheless, there's plenty of room to move around freely...no binding in the shoulders or upper arms. 

I bought this shirt for a work shirt, but I've received "nice shirt" compliments while out and about.  Wait...compliments on a flannel shirt?  Yep!  So, now this is a dual purpose work and go to dinner shirt.
review.name: Could Wear this Every Day

review.reviewBody: At 200+ pounds, I'm a bit large for this kayak and probably would be better off with the Dirigo 120, but there are some advantages to the 106.  1.  It actually fits inside my SUV (barely), meaning I can just toss it in and go, without having to strap it to the roof.  2. I mostly kayak a narrow river with many fallen trees that I have to dodge -- go over, under, or around.  This kayak is quick, maneuverable and responds well -- the Dirigo is more narrow than the other Old Town Rec Kayaks (Loon, Sorrento), and it allows better lean.  While the Dirigo 120 would be faster on flat water, the 106 is quicker and more responsive in challenging water.  This kayak is rightly not classified for whitewater -- no reason to encourage a novice to attempt class 3 rapids -- but an experienced paddler should be able to navigate class 1 and 2.  This kayak also would be good for a smaller paddler looking for a rec kayak that is easy to carry and maneuver, while allowing them to develop skills.
review.name: Not a bad little boat

name: Dirigo 106 Kayak

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am a bike packer and gravel rider. I underestimated how good this  fleece would be on the bike. It breathes super well but is warm on the downhills. Conversely it is stylish at work. It is a base/ mid layer , not a bulky fleece. It’s streamlined enough to wear on a bike or running. I can see this as a base layer for skiing this winter and nordic ski adventures. It’s light enough to come along backpacking or bike touring.
review.name: Great lightweight hooded fleece!

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is the worst fleece I have ever bought. The slightest contact with Velcro or a rough surface will cause the treads to fray and tear out. It is very cheaply made. Do not buy this item.
review.name: Horrible Quality

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and well made! Fjallraven has the best fit for my body type.
review.name: Love it!!

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love it. It has a very athletic/slim fit. It’s a good base layer and performs well on its own when it’s not too cold
review.name: Great fit and style

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Go to midlayer.  Don't know you have it on, no restriction of movement.
Excellent all round fleece.
review.name: All day

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love this fleece which fits well and is perfect for summer evenings or chilly airports! I have traveled with it and hiked in it when the temps are below 65 F. The pockets are well placed and the hood provides both sun protection and keeps the chill away.
review.name: Love this fleece

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wish the Expedition Down Pack Hoodie came in better colors.  Otherwise, I like fjallraven!
review.name: Like the clothes especially the quality

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Picked this up as a lightweight fleece for active use because most of my fleeces are too heavy and don't do well with sweat. This has performed great. Material is light yet does a great job with moisture wicking. Sizing is definitely slim fit. I would recommend sizing up if you are between sizes. I am 5'11 170, and I originally ordered a medium, but it was skin tight. I exchanged for a large, which fits well. Still slightly tight around the shoulders, but overall is good. I have used it for rock climbing and I have been satisfied. It is very light, so not recommended for low temps.
review.name: Fantastic Lightweight Fleece

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Recently picked up the two-tone blue and I have worn it every day since! Soft, versatile, sleek, and I haven't found that it snags like the other reviewers noticed. Thumb hooks are slightly misplaced but do the trick while putting on your next layer.

This is definitely a mid layer as the bottom half is very breathable and doesn't retain much heat on its own.

I do agree with the sizing up. I wear a women's US 16 / XL and the men's 2x Abisko has a comfy, slim fit on me with slightly long sleeves.
review.name: Awesome everyday hoodie

review.itemreviewed: Abisko Trail Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Fjallraven.... PLEASE re-release the 1/4 zip version!!!
If I had known the 1/4 zip would be discontinued I would have ordered at least a couple more of these gorgeous pieces. I love the breathable lower part of the torso and the abrasion resistant upper part around the shoulders and chest. Also love how the collar that stays high and keeps its shape when zipped open. Also love how deep down the 1/4 zip zipper goes down the sternum literally above the stomach, it releases heat in seconds. The Napoleon pocket its gorgeous cause it is firm and keeps its shape. Last but not least I loved the neck without a hood which locks down heat right when I need it by pulling that gorgeous leather pull. Please revive that lovely piece of gear.
review.name: LOOOOOOVE the 1/4 Zip version (hoodless)

name: Abisko Trail Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Almost perfect. The pockets are accessible with a rucksack. The sleeves are long, which is good. But the cuffs are very loose. Well made and warm. Would be great in brighter colours.
review.name: Almost perfect. The pockets are

review.reviewBody:
Instantly become my go to jacket... whether it be for wearing during a hike, in the evening/morning when camping or just a stroll around town. Not only is it warm and light, but the fit is perfect - snug enough so as not to act as a sail in windy conditions but loose enough so as not to restrict movement. I carry it with me everywhere... because you never know when adventure will come beckoning!

HOWEVER, packing it into it's left pocket has been impossible to achieve. I have numerous jacket/fleece which has this functionality and I am able to pack these away comfortably (even when exhausted at the end of a long day) so...
review.name: Perfect in everyway except for one...

review.reviewBody: A lovely synthetic jacket that doesn't look like a puffa, warm and comfortable even though really light. Only issue is it's so easy to mark. Water marks around the cuffs and now left with marks where stains won't wash through.
review.name: Great but really easily marked

review.reviewBody: Incredibly warm for its size. Much better than anything down or synthetic that I have had before. Good sized chest pocket (finally!) on a well cut but not over styled womens fit. Really like the soft cuffs and generous hood too. Top bit of kit.
review.name: Incredibly warm for its size.

review.reviewBody: Light, warm and comfortable. Love the sleeves the way they hug the wrists in such a comfortable way. Nice to have it already logo'd with AMI.
review.name: Light, warm and comfortable. Love

review.reviewBody:
This has quickly become my most worn Rab jacket!
Super light, comfy, packs down really small, breathable and perfect for taking on all sorts of adventures.
Really love it!
review.name: Awesome Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We love our collapsible pot. When space is an issue, but you like to cook real food while car camping, this pot is great! The pouring spout is a great added feature.
review.name: Collapsible Pot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was ecstatic to receive this from Influenster! I honestly never even knew something like it existed and now I want them all! Absolutely gorgeous color and easily folds up!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If you like compact and portable items, this pouring pot fulfills those needs! I wouldn’t say this is the lightest item ever made, however, the quality of the pot itself feels durable and safe to use as long as the instructions are followed.
review.name: Compact and Durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a purchase you will be happy that you made! The product is made well and perfect for camping! Good size, light weight, easy to clean and storage.
review.name: Very lightweight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Works super well. Love that it's collapsible which is a must for storage reasons while camping or backpacking. The pan also cooks evenly and holds heat well.
review.name: Perfect size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This little gem is lightweight, small and capacity, but expands to a fairly deep pot that would be great to have for camping or to add to your bug-out bag like I have in my picture! You already know that as soon as it arrived on my doorstep, my husband and I brought out all of our camping supplies. We tested out the pot on our camping stove (just with water) and it heated up quickly. The quality of the collapsible pot was excellent. The only trouble we had was figuring out how to open it up initially, as you have to remove the handle and then reattach it. It will be very handy for our upcoming camping trips, as camping season is about to begin for us.
review.name: Light weight and compact!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for those who love camping just like me, this pot decreases and increases! Very good to carry in your backpack! You don't need to take a lot of things and everything compacted perfectly!
review.name: Frontier UL Collapsible Pouring  Pot -2.2L

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super awesome pot, perfect for outdoor activities such as camping, and this will definitely be used a lot and I love that it’s collapsible as it takes up hardly any dove, definitely one of the best inventions out there. Thank you Influenster
review.name: Great pot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this! This amazing pot is perfect on the go. It holds more than I had expected and is easy to clean up due to the silicone and the food cooks evenly
review.name: Easy to clean compact pot

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my wife as she’s just getting into running. She absolutely loves the hijab. It’s breathable, the drawstring keeps the hair in place and it’s not too snug around the face. She wants 5 more. Overall great design. Only complaint is standard colours like black are a bit hard to come by. Looking forward to future designs.
review.name: Awesome for running

review.reviewBody: I think of it as a "cowl" because I'm not interested in the religious implications of a hijab. It has wider shoulders than a balaclava and contains stray hair under a helmet or cap.
review.name: nice cowl

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable and holds up really well. Hands down the best activewear hijab out there.
review.name: Best Activewear Hijab on the Market

review.reviewBody: I'll start off by saying I am a man and I purchased this to wear while being outdoors. I burn like a marshmallow and have tried different items to protect myself from the sun and biting insects with limited success. Whether it's fishing, gardening, or mowing the lawn this has been the first item which, when paired with an OR bug net, has truly kept me protected outdoors without me being uncomfortably warm. I definitely recommend. It runs a little tight, but I also understand I'm not the target demographic, so I would never sing it on that.
review.name: Offered the UV I needed with comfort!

review.reviewBody: I wrote a review previously about how loud the material felt- I ended up keeping the scarf because I missed the return deadline and I found it was great for wearing canoeing in +34C weather!! I am used to a chiffon scarf that is very thin, but once you get used to this scarf it is perfect! Super light weight and feels barely there
review.name: I would but this product again

review.reviewBody: I never leave a review for anything but I love this hijab! It's so lightweight and it keeps my hair in place. It didn't slip at all for me during a 5 mile run even when I picked up the pace! I immediately bought 2 more after my first run. Definitely recommend! I've tried multiple hijabs (Nike, underarmour, haute hijab, lululemon) and this is by far my favorite.
review.name: LOVE this! Best sports hijab I've tried

review.reviewBody: This hijab had a nice shape on the face and felt lightweight. Unfortunately the fabric panels around the ears is thick and makes a rustling sound when you love. I found it hard to hear with the hijab on. I will be returning this product so I did not get a chance to test how it performs in the heat or when doing activity.
review.name: Loud fabric

name: ActiveIce Hijab

review.reviewBody: This tight price is U.S. $89.00, But they sale for $119.00.
review.name: The price is higher price on tag

review.reviewBody: Giving these 5 stars for functionality and quality, but I ended up returning them. I am a large in the Peak Mission tight so I ordered a large in these, too. Unfortunately they are much too big. I?m a touch over 5?9? and athletic. If you?re on the fence I?d recommend trying a medium first.
review.name: Great tight but runs large

review.reviewBody: I ordered these tights for walking my dog on cold mornings, but after I walk her I can't seem to take them off, since they are just so dang comfortable!   I have been wearing them pretty much every morning...and then I do yoga in them...and then eventually I put on stretchy jeans for a few hours.  I have yet to wash them, yet miraculously they don't stink!  The pockets are fabulous, I don't keep my phone that close to my body for extended periods of time (you shouldn't either;-) but for a moment when I need my hands free, they are perfect!   I am used to high-waisted, booty lifting Lululemon tights, so at first glance I didn't feel like these tights were very flattering, but my partner strongly disagrees...and I keep grabbing them instead of the Lulus so that says a lot.  5'4" 110lbs and XS fits great, hits at the ankle, doesn't feel too tights or slide down.  LOVE THEM!
review.name: I can't stop wearing these tights!

review.reviewBody:
The Pack Out Pants are my absolute favorite pants. They have the perfect fit, snug but not compression tight. The waistband is wide and comfy. The seams are flattering. The pockets are supremely functional. I a pair in each color. I buy them for gifts and people love them. I tell all my girlfriends about them, and they buy them, too.

It will be a sad day when Patagonia changes the design or sells out.
review.name: Favorite of all favorites

review.reviewBody: Based on the reviews, I thought I was in for a long love affair with these Patagonia tights. I bought in grey and plum in my usual size medium and they were as comfortable as advertised, but about 2" too long and ill-fitting in all the wrong places (around the knees, under glutes). I might have been able to wear a small, but given the price I just took my first shot as a sign that it was not meant to be.  Good news to those of you who like to order multiples of items - both pair fit exactly the same and were of the same good quality. Called customer service with question about return process and Ryan was v. helpful, courteous, etc. Thanks to Backcountry for making it easy to be a loyal/return customer.
review.name: Wanted to love

name: Pack Out Tights - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I have planter fascitis. aka: : over worked feet on cement for to many years. I have to wear insoles it doesn't matter brand. Keen's give me Ithe SUPPORT but I also have boney feet so I need cushion where it counts, at ankle bone, top of foot. . .
PLUS
Keens give me the structure I need with a wide toe box for bunions. My feet are not wide naturally but they need room in toe box- KEEN DOES. Yet they are boney foot regular everywhere else and amazing that the heal is narrow enough for my feet. My heal. never skips in a Keen

KEENS are everything I need and STYLISH! My 25 year old thinks they are cool.

Plus the Chelsea keeps me dry and cozy but not too warm. I walked about 4 miles in them the first day I got them and my feet feel great. Plus easy to get on and off.
review.name: I Love My Chelsea's

review.reviewBody: need at least a size up. , or two sizes i will try to get a lace up since these are difficult on & off. It's a tight fit.
review.name: hard to put on & take off

review.reviewBody: Just what I was looking for in a light ankle boot. I am a little disappointed in Keen though, in that with one instep push to the heel, the leather tore away. Do love the color though.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Getting better and better as I get them broken in. Great foot bed.
review.name: Great boot!

review.reviewBody: The boots were tight and hard to get on or off at first, but this is getting easier every time I wear them. I would recommend ordering up a half size if you plan on wearing thick socks. And wear socks that come up taller than the boot as the seams and elastic areas are hard on the skin, at least at this point they are. But I like them, they are warm and waterproof, and I like their appearance.
review.name: I like them

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Darling as these are, they’re impossible to get on and off. My husband literally had to pull and twist to get the left one off. Sadly, back they went.
review.name: Impossible to Get On and Off

review.reviewBody: I wear them everywhere. I bought them because of foot issues. Keen provides support and they are comfortable and they're stylish.
review.name: I wear them everywhere. I

review.reviewBody: I love Keen boots and they are great for hiking but I needed a boot that I could slip on like these. Once they are on, they are not as heavy as my hiking boots. I'm wearing them everywhere
review.name: Love these boots!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sorry to report I had to return these, I didn't realize the upper front section is way too stiff to walk in. It presses hard in front, above my ankle.
review.name: Cannot walk in these, way too rigid.

review.reviewBody:
I haven’t taken them off since I got them! Returned the first pair as there run small with regular or winter socks. 

Theses are exactly what I was looking for with a skip on boot. The backs are stiff enough to step in without having to pull on. Exceedingly comfortable right out of the box, warm in the snow . 
 My search for the perfect slip on boot is over, absolutely would and will buy again.
review.name: I haven’t taken them off

name: Greta Chelsea Waterproof Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Transport Chukka GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: All weather, light, supportive and comfortable all at the same time! My first pair and true to size (7 1/2). Can't wait to get another pair!
review.name: All I wanted and more

review.itemreviewed: Transport Chukka GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes for work and they have been extremely comfortable, however after only three wears they are tearing and the rubber sole is peeling. AFTER THREE DAYS. Not only is the quality so cheap but the runs too big, I bought a 9.5 a size I usually wear, but these feel like either a 10 or 10.5.
review.name: comfortable but poor quality

review.itemreviewed: Transport Chukka GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These were absolutely perfect for our vacation. Comfortable and good looking shoes that were fit for every occasion.
review.name: Awesome shoes

review.itemreviewed: Transport Chukka GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I can't find these anywhere in a store (wish I could try them on for sizing) so I ordered them online. I love that they're Gore-Tex but the shoe seemed to run on the larger side. I returned them hoping to order a 1/2 size smaller but am waiting for my credit card to be refunded first. I also didn't care for the black color. I will try the beige color next.
review.name: Runs large

review.itemreviewed: Transport Chukka GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I thought the whole sneaker would be cream that why I purchased it cause of the color. It has a light gray suede like material in the front, to my dismay it's not completely cream color. Too much of a hassle to return cause it took Hoka a month to refund the money for the black ones when I wanted an exchange and didn't honor me the discount until after the Oatmilk shoes were shipped. I can't tell you how many times I've called Hoka. I don't know what's going on with this company, if they're short staffed or what but I didn't have this experience when I purchased my first pair with them.
review.name: Not the color I expected

review.itemreviewed: Transport Chukka GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my fourth pair of HOKAs and I'm obsessed. I was specifically looking for a waterproof fall hiking shoe and found it with the Transport Chukka. Solid construction, super stylish - it will be hard not to wear these for everyday errands in addition to trails. Color is gorgeous (Smokey Quartz) matches my Patagoina W's Down Sweater jacket perfectly (Dulcet Mauve) and the reflective details are a great addition. My only note is go half size down - I'm a 7.5 in the Speedgoat, Speedgoat Mid and Kaha. I needed a 7.0 for Great purchase!!!
review.name: These shoes even impressed my husband!!

review.itemreviewed: Transport Chukka GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Runs big so dropped from 8.5 to 8 great fit now. I use them for walking and gym and the cushioning is great.
review.name: Second pair

review.itemreviewed: Transport Chukka GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this boots to test Them to see if I can use them for a Camino del Norte in Spain walk trail hiking next year for use them for ten days. I believe they are great so far good grip, not heavy at all and super comfortable for the feet. Is like walking in a cloud. Only one dissatisfaction the color is not the one shown they came like lavender color not the one in the picture. Other than that a 10. For all the good features. My 5 th pair of HOKA's.
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Transport Chukka GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wear an 8.5 in Cliftons and ordered the same in these. These are a solid inch longer so had to return. I did not order a smaller size because they weren't chukka enough for me...just too clunky looking I guess.
review.name: Nice but huge

review.itemreviewed: Transport Chukka GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I like the color: very chic and blend with most of the colors. For comfort: i give it 5 stars! It very comfortable for standing for long times. However; the size runs very large!! Almost one size up. So if you order it order a size or half a size down.
review.name: Runs very large

name: Transport Chukka GTX Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: They are great,  fit is great,  heel cup is perfect, snug, no movement even without tightening them . In fact,  i felt that at first they were too tight in the foot ball area. And i  had to leave them quiet loose but my foot sometimes will start feeling numb. Because they're knit i didn't think it would ever change,  since they can't really stretch,  but they are perfect now. Stiff, well fitting and great looking.  The only problem is that they get dirty fast. So in order to avoid washing them constantly and risking to damage them too soon,  i wear shoe protectors/ shoe socks over them :(. That effectively hides the bright color, which was the main reason i chose pink instead of black, to increase visibility on the road. And, btw, atomic red is kind of coral. Actually  nice color, i love it. I don't like pink, but they're not that. But you can't just wipe them clean,  so that's the only issue.  They're highly breathable,  well vented ( i ride in very hot climate). Great shoe.
review.name: Awesome shoes

review.reviewBody: I've been riding these shoes hard for a year now. The fit is incredible and they remain my favorite pair. The white mesh tends to get a bit dirty in the rain, so avoid that. Or get the black pair and just don't worry about it!
review.name: One Year Later

review.reviewBody: After getting my cleat set just right and a short break in; these shoes have got to be the best shoes I've ridden with. Ultra comfortable; really stiff; vents really well; awesome styling. Id recommend sizing down a half to a full size but other than that these shoes are everything youre looking for.
review.name: Amazing shoes
comment: I ordered my normal size and fit is great.
Thanks for the review. Will you clarify if the shoes run small or run big? You recommended sizing down from your normal size but yet the shoes run small.

review.reviewBody:
I've worn a lot of high end shoes and these perform as expected. The foot opening molds to the wearer like a sock and the compressive fit is echoed throughout. I got the white model and they were the whitest cleanest shoes i've ever seen, that didn't last too long and the color patinaed pretty quickly but that's to be expected with blindingly white shoes. The heel cup gave me the impression that there would be some slipping but there was in fact no slippage at all on rides. I've put over 1,000 miles on these bad boys and would probably get another pair.

If you're in the market for something that is light, extremely vented, and stiff, then you'd be hard pressed to find something better. Only 4/5 because of the white not holding color for long. (i did ride in the rain, so probably my fault).
review.name: Stiff and uncompromising fit

review.reviewBody: These are a true race shoe -- light, super stiff, and very close fitting.  Toe box is on the medium to narrow side, no heal movement.  Average ventilation.  The BOA fasteners work like all the rest and are very adjustable in both directions.  Cleat adjustment is good, can get sufficiently rearward.  Materials, construction, and workmanship seem on par with other pro level shoes. Sizing seems to be slightly on the small size but they are supposed to be tight -- this is NOT a Gran Fondo shoe.  Are they comparable to other pro level shoes?  Yes, and far superior to any other PI shoe offered in the past.  If on sale, a bargain, IF you want a true, no compromises, race shoe.  At full price, a matter of fit vs. all the others.  And yes, the red is actually pink.
review.name: Full  Bore Race Shoe

review.reviewBody:
Very breathable, feels like a second sock. Don't really need to ratchet down boa's unless you like an extra tight fit. The vents on the bottom are great on hot days to help keep feet dry when matched with good wicking socks. Could use a little extra arch support but that's personal. Also, very pink, not red.

Wear an 11 in running shoes, 45-46 in most cycling shoes. These were a definite 46 for me.
review.name: Like wearing a second sock, runs small

review.reviewBody:
Very bright pink. Pretty cool looking really but very pink. Hifiz for sure. Tried to dye them with dark red dye but did not work. Photos are after the dye which changed it a touch more toward an orange.

Otherwise great shoe. Super stiff sole, lightweight, snug fit. True to size. 

Recommend overall just beware about the red one being pink.
review.name: Pink not red

review.reviewBody:
They're coral.  Closer to Giro pink than red.  
They felt tight across the top of my foot no matter the Boa setting and so I returned them.
review.name: They're not red.

review.reviewBody:
On a recommendation from one of the gearheads I decided to try these even though I had 
reservations simple because they were labeled Pearl Izumi.
Well here's the issues with these.
Boa dials are the old style very noisy and no micro adjustments. Sound like a rachet wrench going bad.
FIt- Ordered a 44.5 my usual size 10 and same according to their chart. Couldn't even get my foot into  the sock like opening to try to put the shoe on.  The insole I could not spread enough. (I am a typical 10 D in shoes)The fabric around that you would normally put your foot into is roughly cut on the edges and really not high quality at all. 
I could not get my foot in these to try the heel cup but it too seemed to be of inferior padding etc.
These shoes are priced the same as Specialized Sworks 7, Shimano RC-9,  Bontrager XXX and clearly are not in the same league. While you may not be looking for a pro-level shoe at least they should be constructed and use the higher quality materials these others use.
review.name: Total junk -

name: PRO Road Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Cropped Boxy Snap Front Puffer - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought it out of season but still came up with some reasons to wear it. Love the style and warmth. Would get one in every color if I could!
review.name: So cute

review.itemreviewed: Cropped Boxy Snap Front Puffer - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Beautiful color, heavy and seems to be very warm. However, it runs too large. I ordered a M, my usual size, and I can get lost inside it.
I think I will have to go with a XS. My hands disappear inside the sleeves.
review.name: Almost perfect, since it's too big

review.itemreviewed: Cropped Boxy Snap Front Puffer - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I had somewhat low expectations for the warmth of this jacket at this price point but I have yet to be cold in it and it’s big enough to layer a chunky sweater under. I’m usually a medium but I got a large so I could layer. The crop cut makes it boxy so I don’t drown in it. The style and fabric finish look very simple, classic, and slightly elevated compared to normal outdoor brands.
 Also the pockets are amazing!! They’re open on the top and the sides and I can fit so much stuff in them. I no longer need a fanny pack or bag, I can fit my keys, wallet, dog poop bags, chapstick, phone, and more in there and still put my hands in the side openings. 
I thought the snaps would be annoying but they’re super easy and nice because you can close/open as much as you want.
I got the downtown brown and it’s a great color!!
I’ve worn it pretty much every day for over a month (since I got it). Highly recommend this jacket, I’ve been telling my friends to get it.
review.name: Surprisingly warm and great pockets

name: Cropped Boxy Snap Front Puffer - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I now have all three colors of this shirt. It is so comfortable and light. You can dress it up or go straight to casual wear. 
Perfect!
review.name: Soooo comfortable!

review.reviewBody: So comfortable and cool.  Material is the best ever used for warm weather MTB.  Cut and fit are epic
review.name: Great material, light and cool

review.reviewBody: This shirt has performed well on both bike rides and at work. I went with M for a more relaxed fit and it's perfect for my shorter torso; the cropped length is flattering and functional as it reduces the unnecessary fabric that I'd otherwise have pulled way over my bottoms. It breathes super well unlike a lot of "hiking" shirts that make the same claims. The material is so thin it packs down to practically nothing, it doesn't wrinkle, and I successfully handwashed/dried it overnight in a humid hotel room. It's so versatile I feel like I've got 3 shirts in one with this. I still consider this a new shirt as I haven't worn it more than 10 times so I can't speak yet on its durability, but so far I've been impressed with how fresh it looks after every wash.
review.name: breathable on humid days

review.reviewBody: I have 3 and as new colors come out I have no doubt I'll collect more. Very comfortable, loose and flowy fit. The crop is just the right length and gives a more feminine fit to the current button up jersey trend. I've worn it for long rides, short rides, xc rides, downhill rides, and even to work. I get a compliment every time I wear it, even as business wear!
review.name: Best womens mtb jersey by far

review.reviewBody: Great MTB shirt -loose and comfy. Oversized fit
review.name: So comfy

review.reviewBody: Own 3 and love them all.  Short, looseish and great fabric.  Perfect for riding and everything else.  Compliments every time I wear one.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Great fit and feel!  Fun pattern, its great!
review.name: LOVE

review.reviewBody: Finally a femme cropped button-up shirt!!!!!!!   I've worn this from work straight to mountain biking.  Fabric wicks sweat well and is just so comfortable.  LOVE!!!
review.name: Obsessed!

review.reviewBody: I love this shirt.  The cut, fabric, stretch, and fit.  I’m a shorty and this length is hard to find.  Works with baggies or bibs.  I measured a small on chart, but ordered the xs and glad I did.  I don’t want too much fabric flapping in the wind.
review.name: My favorite

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this top. It’s so much more than I expected: stylish, great fit, stretchy, cute, comfortable, versatile.
review.name: It’s perfect

name: Slickrock Short-Sleeve Button-Up Jersey - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Zephyr Mid TF Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I live and hike in the Sangre de Christos mtns of NM and I think gortex boot liners feel like plastics bags inside my boots. So I buy high quality wool socks and wear summer boots all year long, even though at altitude we usually have a couple feet of snow on the ground. Sooo much more comfortable and they dry fast. Work great with snow shoes. Not for everybody but if you like this idea, these are the right boots. They last about 2-3 years at 15-20 miles a week, 40-50 weeks a year.
review.name: Lightweight, breathable support

review.itemreviewed: Zephyr Mid TF Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought my first pair ten years ago for a hike up Mt. Whitney. Love them and eventually wore them out. Was happy to see they still make the same boot. The second pair are the same, nothing changed. Very comfortable, no break in needed.
review.name: Second Pair

review.itemreviewed: Zephyr Mid TF Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable out of the box. I?m usually a size 11, and this seems true to size.  It?s so hard to find hiking boots without goretex, so I was happy to find that these are excellent for locations where breathability trumps waterproofing.  My only issue is that the sole seems to wear down quickly.
review.name: True desert boot

review.itemreviewed: Zephyr Mid TF Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just replaced these boots.  I remember hiking in my already well broken in pair when my almost 40 year old son was in scouts.  I remember standing on a for Habitat for Humanity that was so hot I was sliding down the tar paper that was becoming liquid under me.  So how long, durable and comfortable are they?  Well I can honestly say I should have retired them 5 years ago.  I finally gave in now that the heels are hollowed out and I find bits and pieces of them beside my bed every day.  LOVE THESE BOOTS!
review.name: The Forever every Day boot

name: Zephyr Mid TF Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe around a month ago because it was half off and I had heard great things about the Specialized S-Works. It is a great looking shoe.  But like many reviews it is super super stiff and needs some good breaking in.  I ultimately decided I didn't want to wait to break it in and I wasn't so stoked about the laces. I sent them back and purchased the Shimano RX8.
review.name: Too Stiff

review.reviewBody: I have an average woman’s foot and this is my third pair of Specialized shoes. The other two are road shoes, but the fit is identical and I had none of the weird rubbing issues that some reviewers commented on. The stiffness is excellent and durability excellent.
review.name: These deserve a much better rep!

review.reviewBody:
I’ve read the reviews and own many generations of S Works shoes. Almost everyone will have the ankle bone issue because the material is too hard around Lateral and medial malleolus: the bony knob on the outside and inside of the ankles. Specialized has corrected this on most of the boa shoes by lowering the material, but they have not done it on this one. 

The solution is simple if you don’t want to wear band-aids while you wait for the material to break in. You take a heat-gun or powerful blow dryer and you heat the material that would touch your ankle bone and massage it while it’s hot. Don’t overheat the material it should be hot enough to touch with the hand and you will feel the material soften up. It’s not just the green area it an also the black padded area that has a stiff pipe like material in it. 

Once you break it in, which should take about 15 minutes to do both shoes, the shoes fit like a glove. 

I wore them before, when they were super stiff, and then after, when I softened them up and they were amazing. 

The toe box area is super comfortable compared to other S-Works shoes and ai think over time they will break in nicely. 

At 50% off they are totally worth it.
review.name: Amazing once you fix the ankle rub issue

review.reviewBody: Really hard shoe.  As in, requires breaking in.  Rubs at tongue, really not worth the $.
review.name: Nice shoe but super uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: I too was concerned about the ankle rub issues that some have experienced.  I decided to take  a chance and I am glad I did so.  I have high arches and narrow ankle bones.  No issues.  I have about 150 miles riding in them and they are breaking in nicely.  Good show @ the discounted price.
review.name: Works well for me!

review.reviewBody: I was apprehensive about ordering these secondary to the many reviews about the discomfort at the ankles. But with the Specialized footbed insert these are amazing. Gives me great power transfer in a lightweight shoe. Perfect for me. Might get a second pair as a backup/replacement.
review.name: Love these (non-ankle biters)

review.reviewBody:
These are now a great shoe, but I had to cut the tops of them to not stab my ankles. If you're OK with some DIY modifications to make these work, they are light, stiff, and if you have other Specialized shoes the sizing should be spot on. (It was for me, at least.)

I had to use an angle grinder with a sanding disk to clearance the tops of each shoe to not stab / cut into my ankles. Its really surprising Specialized missed it by so much. You can see by other reviews on here I am not the only one with this problem.
review.name: Ankle Stabbers

review.reviewBody: Great shoe, super light and stiff, planning on using them on the gravel bike. Only issue is the tongue is not long enough so the edges of the show give me a nice blister where the tongue should be. Not a deal breaker but annoying, you have to where thick socks with them.
review.name: Super stiff and light but

review.reviewBody: After getting used to the lace up style, my riding was very comfortable.  The shoe feels very solid yet light.  Easy to walk in without worry of damaging tge clete or anyone's floors.  The ankle issues mentioned by others could be an issue if your ankle bones are low.
review.name: New life

review.reviewBody: My first ride with these was fine and then I had the similar ankle issues that others spoke about. Just wrapped a 3 hour ride and have cuts in the sides of my ankles because of these. I got these because I had the Specialized Recon 3.0s (with the boas) and thought these would fit the same. I was wrong :(
review.name: I wanted to love these, ouch

name: S-Works Recon Lace Shoe

review.reviewBody: I use the boots to take my dogs for walks when it's raining - I just recently purchased them, so I'm sure they will come in handy at other times as well.
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: I really loved this boot. It was warm, completely water proof (which I needed bc I purchased for possibly walking through ankle deep puddles,) and looks good enough to wear to dinner. I have to give 3 stars because even with a sock up to my knee, the boot really ate up, to the point of bleeding, the skin of my ankle/leg at the sides where the rubber opens to allow for the stretch of the side panel. I read many reviews and only ONE other mentions getting cuts. I had hoped my anatomy would not put me in that category, but it did. I am working on creating some sort of cuff or padding to add on by sewing or glue bc I wore the boots with bandages covered by moleskin on my out of country trip, so they are not returnable. I had worn them around the house, and could feel a little scratching, but I assumed a sock would cover the spot.
review.name: Great except for one thing.

review.reviewBody: My only complaint is that they are narrow around the ankle so unless you wear higher socks or tuck your pants in they can rub and be uncomfortable.
review.name: Stylish

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and light. Love the style and will wear for a long time.
review.name: Great comfort and style

review.reviewBody: So cute and comfy! My feet also don't overheat in them which is the case with most boots.
review.name: Comfy and light weight!

review.reviewBody: These boots are comfortable to wear and walk in. I love the burnt orange color helping me to have more beautiful orange in my life. Completely waterproof keeping my feet dry in Tennessee mountain torrents. Love that they are ankle high. My only challenge is getting them on as they are a bit too narrow at the opening but once they're on I'm good to go!
review.name: Quite happy with my purchase!

review.reviewBody: Great fitting boot, good toe box area and comfort. Enjoy walking in these.
review.name: One of the best rain boots for comfort.

review.reviewBody: Great fix, just need to wear longer socks since the sides pinch.
review.name: Great boot minus the pinch to the ankles

review.reviewBody: I love them! They've been easy to transition into, I've been wearing long pants and long socks with them so I haven't had weird chafing.i don't think I could walk around all day in them but they're good getting to and from work.
review.name: Gets the job done

review.reviewBody: I had bought these for spring and summer walks in the woods because I loved my "winter" Bogs. Both pairs have been super comfortable from the very first walk. I especially liked the orange color of these short boots.
review.name: So comfortable, and love the color!

name: Holly Chelsea Rain Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Nice jacket but it is not waterproof. Everytime I wear it, even in a light rain, it's wet on the inside within an hour. Material is not shedding water, it just absorbs it. I don't trust this jacket enough to take it anywhere important. Feels like a huge waste of money when I have jackets that perform better at 1/4 the price.
review.name: Not waterpoof

review.reviewBody: The price, fit and function are what you want from a Simms product. Anyone looking for a quality jacket should checlout the Simms Freestone
review.name: Freestone Wading Jacket

review.reviewBody: Flawless construction and waterproofing. Perfect for long floats down the Delaware River Systems and walking the dog.
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody:
Well, I think the fine folks over at simms have done it again. The price is nice, pockets are big, the zippers are solid, and a durable outer shell that has held up to the brush that I've currently put it through. I would recommend this to anyone. From your lowly local fishing guide, to your avid rain dancing enthusiast, this jacket will keep dry while looking good whatever you decide to do. 

P.S.
fish whistle 3.0?
review.name: so far so good...

review.reviewBody: The Freestone wading jacket is an awesome piece of my kit. It keeps me dry and I love the big pockets.
review.name: Freestone wading jacket

review.reviewBody: On the Lake, on a boat fishing in steady rain, this jacket will not allow water to break thru. You can run 40 plus MPH without wind or rain making it to your body. Excellent.
Just got it for an outtershell and it has been amazing!
review.name: Love This Jacket

review.reviewBody: Great jacket, all simms products have the quality that I look for. Customer for life!

I was surprised at the quality of this jacket. tested at 2 degrees with constant rain for 5 hours and stayed dry. very good windproof and waterproof as it should be. The reputation of Simms clothing is well established
review.name: Freestone wadding jacket

review.reviewBody: 5 Star Jacket if it was sized better.  Medium is really a large.  At least for me.  5’7” 158 lbs.  it’s my second wading jacket.  First one lasted 10+ years of very hard (nearly daily) in wet and windy Pacific NW before starting to show some wear at the seams.  First one a bit too oversized too.
review.name: Versatile Jacket

name: Freestone Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Friend of mine has one of these which caused me to lean that direction.  Very easy to put together and is a solid, well built rack.  Highly recommended!!!
review.name: Great Rack and Easy Install

review.reviewBody: I bought this rack to mount my roof top tent. It's a solid rack and the everything fits well and slides easily. My only complaint is the plastic end caps for the bars had already snapped off. I barely touched them and the cheap plastic end cap just broke off. Not great for the price you pay. They should be made out of aluminum. The Installation instructions are also terrible. I'm very mechanical so I was able to figure it out but many people would be lost. How about using some words.
review.name: Solid Rack

review.reviewBody: I thought it would be taller. I was thinking about hauling a ladder but it’s too short for long ladders.
review.name: Short of the cab by 6”

review.reviewBody: The product probably is a good product but i still do not have any rails to mount it on! I have everything else, which is useless without the rails.
review.name: NO Rails
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule XSporter Pro Shift. 
The bed rails used to attach the overhead rack to the vehicle are sold separately, since the individual rails required are different based on the vehicle they are attached to. Using the "Select Your Vehicle" tool on the Thule.com Truck Racks product page will show the complete collection of components needed to complete this installation.

review.reviewBody: Building process was a bit more cumbersome than anticipated. Instructions were almost minimal, which I would have preferred more script than just generic pictures of how it supposed to attach onto the bed of the truck. I also was not given any spare parts for anything section of the build (Very Nerve Wracking). After building the entire system I am very pleased and very happy with my purchase and absolutely love that I can collapse and adjust the rack system to my liking, that was a very big pro! All in all I would recommend anyone this rack system as long as it fits the sizing requirements which is almost all trucks. Something to note for others, I knew this before purchase and wasn't any issue for my intended uses, is that the rack sits an inch or two under the cab height. This is definitely something to be aware of but overall very pleased with this system!
review.name: Perfect Rack system!

name: Xsporter Pro Shift

review.reviewBody: IMO these boots are the best light hikers. I’ve been wearing them since the early 80s, they have the best soul pattern, Gore-Tex liner, and leather. They are my go to footwear or just about everything I do… photography, shooting sports, hiking in the mountains and even driving.
review.name: My everyday footwear

review.reviewBody: I purchased for my son-in-law for Christmas.  He loved them, however, they were a little small.  I wanted to return for a size larger, but they did not have them.
review.name: My son-in-law loved them

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable. Fast shipping as always.
review.name: Awesome boots

review.reviewBody: I love the Vasque boot. The look, the feel, the style is what I wanted. Love the shoe..
review.name: Excellent Footwear

review.reviewBody: I’ve owned Sundowners for decades.  Best boot in the WORLD.  Heard Vasque was discontinued and immediately bought another pair of the GTX boots!  So sad about a Legend..
review.name: Classic and BEST

review.reviewBody: The Vasque Sundowner is the legend. They look sharp, are bombproof, and after a little breaking in, you could set out to hike the AT.  Very good grip and ankle support.  Technology has somewhat overtaken these boots in that they are not the lightest, nor the most technically proficient. Having said that, you will never regret owning a pair of Vasque sundowners.
review.name: Mt. Rushmore of hiking boots

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to like these. Having had them previously, I found that the general fit out of the box was a bit stiff, both in the sole as well as the upper. I tend to run an 11 in running shoes, and the 10.5 fit for length, but felt a bit narrow for my already narrow-ish foot. The instep also felt a bit low cut for me, and ended up feeling like the top of my foot was squeezed by the laces/tongue and upper. I just didn't have the confidence that the break-in was going to work.
Overall, they weren't going to work for me, and I wish they had. Construction looks good, the soles have a tried and true design, and I like the classic leather look.
review.name: Vasque Sundowner-

review.reviewBody: I first bought a paper of Vasque Sundowners around 1990. I used it for years and years (summer hiking mostly). Finally, in 2005 while coming back down half dome, the sole sheared loose. I patched it up and made it back without problem--came home and went to a store and asked for the very best hiking boot they carried. They sold me a German boot (Meindl) very popular in Europe for a hefty price. It lasted for a few years (soles wore out) but never had the feel or durability of the Sundowner. I can tell you 2 things for certain. First, the boots require a break-in period. Don't buy them and head out for a long hike. Second, I have no idea about changes in the materials, etc., but these are the most comfortable boots that i have ever worn. Nothing else is close. Buy hiking boots a bit larger than street shoes.
review.name: Best Boot EVER!

review.reviewBody:
I took my recently graduated son on the trip to Montana to celebrate his recent graduation and being valedictorian of his class. 
I bought two pairs of vasque sundowners but he decided that he would prefer a pair of Timberland boots and so I returned his and kept mine. 
The first day on our trip to Montana we went on a 6.2 mile hike on the trail called beehive valley which climbs to a bit more than 9000 feet. 
A few miles into the hike I felt some burning on the back of my heels. 
I took special care to make sure I was wearing proper hiking socks as well as my son so I was puzzled. He didnt have any issue with his timberlands but I took off my boots at the first chance and noticed I had already some bad blisters forming. It wasn’t long before the back of my heels were in excruciating pain. 
I didn’t want to ruin our first day of the hike so I kept my mouth shut and didnt mention it to my son. 
When we got back from the hike I took off my shoes and saw that it was a bloodbath. 
Hamburger. 
I’ve added the picture of the back of my heels. 
I am astonished that there is a clear lack of padding in fact a stitch seen running down the back of the shoe on the inside that’s very abrasive. 
I had to wear flip-flops for the rest of my five day trip and had to avoid any more hikes which was the whole point of our trip. 
Crazy that this design flaw could exist after so many iterations knowing that these boots are a “classic” and have been around for a long time. 
I definitely would not recommend these boots.
review.name: Yikes.......Ouch!!!!!!!!! Painful

review.reviewBody: You advertise your boots at one sales price.When I try to order you said sorry I.t mistake.You are supposed to honor the sale your advertising.saying that's cheaper that what you pay for it.You are multi billion dollar company honor your sales don't play stupid waiting for you to honor the price
review.name: Vasque mens boots tan and blue

name: Sundowner GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Quasar 3D Insulated Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Quasar 3D Insulated Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Quasar 3D Insulated Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Quasar 3D Insulated Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Quasar 3D Insulated Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I got this pad a couple years ago and have used on a few 4-5 night backpacking trips as well as at the airport for long layovers on international travel and a handful of nights house camping at a packed boy's weekend house.  To start with, and most enjoyable for me, is the comfort level.  I don't usually sleep great on trail.  I've loved the Nemo Tensor for its super light weight and ultra packability, but as a side sleeper (Nemo kills it at the side sleeper game) the Quasar's extra thickness is perfect for me and worth the little extra weight.  I love that I can let a good amount of air out of the pad without bottoming out on the ground, and achieve nearly mattress level sleep quality.  I also love that this pad is bullet proof and I don't fear punctures at night as much on the trail if I haven't cleared the ground properly.  Hard to beat this pad, if you don't mind carrying a few extra ounces.
review.name: Favorite pad

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a cycling trip across the state of Missouri. Nights were chilly but I wasn't thanks to this sleeping pad & my sleeping bag. Sleeping pad was very comfortable with little noise when shifting. Made for comfortable nights.
review.name: 6 days of great sleep

review.reviewBody: I own the Quasar and Tensor sleeping pads by Nemo. The Quasar is slightly heavier and a bit larger so it is more of my go to car camping pad. It has a bevel shape that holds the body in the center and I never slide off of it in the night. I am a frequent tossing and turning type at night. It has a good thickness and keeps your body up from the ground. Highly recommend for car camping!
review.name: A Cozy Car Camping Pad!

review.reviewBody: This is a great sleeping pad for family camping! Kids aren't as gentile with gear, and this pad sacrifices a small amount of weight and packing size to provide a lot more durability and comfort. I definitely think the trade off is worth it!
review.name: Comfortable and durable

review.reviewBody: I purchased this pad to use more as a car camping sleeping pad. I have the Tensor for backpacking as it’s lighter and packs smaller. The quiz are is an incredibly comfortable pad. I have used it on multiple camping trips, and various different types of weather while I have not taken it into extreme cold, it has been on nights in the high 30s. This has kept me warm with no issue. Recently, I had to utilize the pad as an extra bed when we had several out-of-town guests. My one complaint with the pad is the valve cover is tight and feels like it’s going to rip when I deflate it. However, after dozens of uses, it’s fine so I assume the quality of the pad lives up to Nemo standards.
review.name: Comfortable pad!

review.reviewBody: I bought this sleeping pad to help with my comfort levels when sleeping on a cot during disaster deployments. It packs up small and inflates easily with plenty of cushion for side sleepers like myself. It is also very warm. I have not used it directly on the ground, but sleeping on this in conjunction with my Riff sleeping bag kept me TOASTY warm all night. I will note this pad is much quieter than competitors like Therm-A-Rest, but there is still a tiny bit of swishing/crinkle noise. If you wear ear plugs it's completely unnoticeable.
review.name: Great For This Side Sleeper

review.reviewBody: I looked around for so long to find the perfect sleeping pad. Not only does it keep me warm because of the insulation but how it cradles me in the middle is so awesome! It has a slightly elevated spot where your head goes and it’s nice because it works with a pillow or without.
review.name: Perfect choice!

review.reviewBody: I’ve used this sleeping pad for 3 seasons and it’s still good as new! I’m a side sleeper and I love that I don’t wake up with sore hips in the morning. It also rolls up smaller that other brands we have. Also, the bag that you use to inflate it works way better than the other brands as well.
review.name: 3 seasons and going strong!

review.reviewBody: Been using the old Tensor Insulated for several years and picked this up for a little more luxury on trail.  Super quiet, very comfy and overall still stoked on Nemo's gear.  As a side sleeper, it definitely provides a bit more support over the old Tensor.  Slept well with no issues!  Included Vortex pump sack is still the most efficient inflation I've used to date. 4-5 pumps and you're ready to rest.
review.name: Gained proportionate comfort w/ adding a few oz's

review.reviewBody: Took this on a 5 day self support kayak trip.  Excellent balance of weight to comfort.  Both of us are side sleepers and this pad did great. packs small enough for our whitewater boats and is not too heavy.  Thanks NEMO
review.name: Good nights sleep for two.

name: Quasar 3D Insulated Sleeping Pad

review.reviewBody: Breathable and well fitting. Protection from the sun without feeling too stuffy.
review.name: Top tier tech shirt

review.reviewBody:
I live in this thing all summer. On the boat, on the beach, biking the Andes Mountain. 

I also got it treated for mosquito protection. It's my favorite piece of clothing.
review.name: My 3rd one.

review.reviewBody:
Absolutely love this shirt. It’s made of magic. Awesome for summer around water. Dries very quickly. Can wear swimming instead of sunblock.  

Keeps the sun off you and keeps you cool as it breathes well. Also keeps you warm as the sun goes down. I have a bunch of these. I wear them all the time! Great for most outdoor activities.
review.name: Worth every penny

review.reviewBody: I prefer the original astroman sun hoodie design. The material seems less stretchy than the original astroman sun hoodie, also doesn't have the thumb loops. Maybe doesn't dry as fast as the original astroman sun hoodie either. Overall, a downgrade from the previous edition.
review.name: Downgraded Astroman Hoodie

review.reviewBody: Light, breathable, stretchy, and minimalist. Great shell for hiking, running, skiing, or just walking around town. The 'cenote' blue is just right.
review.name: Best shell ever

review.reviewBody: Love this piece so far. I'm 6'4", 250lbs and the XL fits me great. I typically need to order XLT shirts but this is sized well for me. Sleeves are good length but wouldn't have minded another inch. Thumb holes would have been nice. I have to maneuver a little to get it over my chest (46 inch) but it's not a problem, just noticeable. The material has a nice stretch to it. Might have a shirt on underneath or nothing under depending on temperature and wind. Love the hood fit with or without a hat. Zipped up the hood stays on well. Zippers work well. I've washed it several times now and the material and color still look new. Washing on delicate and hang dry. I like it so much I might get another.
review.name: Great so far

review.reviewBody: This did not fit in a medium, yet the OR Alpine Onset Merino 150 Hoody in medium fits perfectly and with room to spare, considering it is a baselayer I would try the next size up in this Astroman but falling right in between sizes M and L on the chart, it probably will be too wide, like another windshirt from OR that I have tried in both M and L (Tantrum 2). I cannot understand why a sun shirt/hoody would fit like a baselayer but there you have it. While the next size up with be ok in the upper torso and arm length, it does not have any elastic or adjustment on the hem so would probably be baggy like a skirt on me. The arms also felt a bit short and had no articulation but I cannot be sure as the overall size is possibly wrong. On me, the waist and hem and neck were all roomy enough but the chest/back was tight and arm length was not long enough or articulated enough for reaching. I am a size M in dead bird, if that helps, but in between with OR, apparently.
review.name: Tight across the back and shoulders and quite short on arms.

review.reviewBody: NO thumb holes!! I missed this in the description for this redesign. Alittle disappointed in that. All around good hoody, but would've been perfect with this little feature added. Fitment is alittle tight across back, so sleeves pull down over time. Thumb holes would've helped with that. Material is stretchy enough to not be uncomfortable, but noticeable. 5'10" 185lb muscular build. I'm normally a medium to large in sizing. I went with large. I'd error on sizing up if you're close.
review.name: Decent

description: Buy the Thule Chariot Yepp Maxi Frame Mount online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chariot Yepp Maxi Frame Mount
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Chariot Yepp Maxi Frame Mount online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Had one stolen with a Mt. bike 26" wheel, Large frame, and replaced it with exactly the same Yepp Maxi ocean blue!
pros - safe for kids 20-45 Lbs.; easy seat add-on only removal with full locking mechanism.
cons - the iron frame that mounts to your bike is almost 2 times heavier than the seat clip-on with 5 point harness that goes with it - truly can't be mounted on a too light weight of a a bike, as the rider can totally loose control of the bike.
overall - heavier load is still well worth the safety assurances you get with using this seat
note - as with ALL bike seats check with you local certified bike shop mechanic first, which bikes/types is this product applicable to, as it's really not meant for the bike types of 4 folks rating this product with 1 star 3-4 years ago, after wanting it to work for them way too bad - reviewers' revenge.
review.name: Best Bike Seat Ever

review.reviewBody:
Wasn't compatible with canti brakes, incompatible with top pull front derailleur, incompatible with frame geometry, and when mounted, the seat tilted forward. 
The concept needs refinement. It's pretty upsetting considering the cost.
review.name: Poor Documentation of Compatibility
comment:
Hello Tom, 
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule Yepp Maxi. While the bike seat is designed to fit to a wide array of different bikes, the cabling on some cantilever bikes may not allow for a secure connection using a frame-mounted bike seat. This is dependent on the cable routing and the geometry of the bike.
If your bike does not safely support the frame-mounted version of this bike seat, it may be a better fit for the rack-mounted version of the product.

review.reviewBody:
we used this for our son from 11 months-4 years (recently updated to a running board-style cargo bike). I think this is one of the best options available for this kind of seat but leaving these suggestions in hopes that certain features could be improved upon in future versions:
-could use a chest level clip (and possibly some kind of detachable headrests on either side, or some kind of recline option?) because my son inevitably fell asleep on the way home from every outing. his head would waggle around, drop forward, and then his shoulders would work their way loose from the straps. I have ridiculous photos of all the different ways we tried to invent diy solutions to this problem
-We used both the standard rack adapter and the extra-long rack adapter on a standard rack, and neither was ideal. Both add a decent amount of weight (We live in NYC and lug our bikes up 3 flights of stairs). I actually ended up busting the welds on 2 different racks after long term use, commuting with a kid plus loaded panniers.
review.name: good seat but could be improved
comment:
It certainly sounds like you and your family are getting a lot of use out of the bike seat! 
Thank you for your feedback on the Thule Thule Yepp Maxi. Customer input is always a vital part of Thule's product design process. Your input has been forwarded to Thule's product development team for reference on the next generation of Thule child bike seats.

review.reviewBody: We used this seat with 2 of our kids, they both loved it.
review.name: Great seat and east to use

review.reviewBody:
My son first started using this at 9 months and he's 2.5 and still loves it. Sturdy and safe. 

There are two versions of this seat - this one for frame mount and the "Easy Fit" for rack mount. It's not completely clear which one is which but this is the frame mount so make sure you're buying the right one. 

We love it!
review.name: Great Product - Doublecheck you have the right one

review.reviewBody: I've had a Yepp Maxi seat for a bit less than a year and a half. This morning the belt came off when tightening - luckly not while biking. This construction doesn't seem safe and I'm surprised that it's legal in my country. The bike stands inside over night and is generally not exposed to sun light or anything else, that could weaken the material. Do not buy this.
review.name: Not safe

review.reviewBody: We bought this to take our son out on rides. I installed it exactly as directed, even used a torque wrench to make sure nothing was over tightened. We used it maybe a dozen times for short rides and it seemed to be getting looser. Took the clamp off and the seat tube of the bike is completely deformed. If you're okay with that, I'd recommend it, but don't mount this to a bike you love with a bigger child/toddler because the bike will be permanently damaged. Save your bike and just get a rack mounted one or a trailer instead.
review.name: Great seat but the clamp will wreck your frame

review.reviewBody: Absolutely no reason to not make an adapter so that the frame-mounted version can be put on a bike rack. Some people have bikes where the frame Mount works better as well as bikes where the rackmount works better. now I have a kids bike seat that can only fit one of my bikes and not the other two. Gets two stars because it does work great as long as it fits on the bike.
review.name: There should be an adapter to put this on a bike r

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my 2 year old and now my 5 yr old doesn't want to ride his bike!
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody: We've been using this seat for 2 years now and just bought another one! It's durable, weather resistant and simple to use.  Our kiddos love them
review.name: Love It

name: Chariot Yepp Maxi Frame Mount
