review.reviewBody: This bag has checked off alll the boxes I had for a carry on.
review.name: Amazing Bag

review.reviewBody: This pack gives you combo of having wet clothes and dry clothes in separate compartments. I use this bag to take my drone, camera and electronics on expeditions.
review.name: Versatile Backpack

review.reviewBody: I’ve used this for the last three times that I’ve flown, and I LOVE it. I was craving a piece of luggage that doesn’t require hands or lugging up stairs, and this is it! This with my tote or large purse, and I’m good to go for up to 3 nights (1-2 being ideal) has so many compartments, is so comfortable, and is so smartly designed. It also opens like a suitcase, which is so much better for travel than when it just opens on top.
review.name: Great for 1-3 night airline travel!

review.reviewBody: I thought that this bag was going to be same but i was shocked! It held 7 outfits, a iPad, and a pair of bulky shoes and it still had a room for more. I also mainly got it for the water bottle holder and it is also super deep. 10/10 can’t wait to use it for oversees trips to canada and japan. I wish they had different colors other than black and brown but i guess that’s a good thing for it not get  dirty fast.
review.name: Very surprised

review.reviewBody: The only reason I took a star off is because I think the bag is not an attractive color. The functionality is stellar— not only does it have a laptop sleeve, but the sleeve can fit two laptops! I love that it opens in the center and has a clean (anti-microbial side) as well as an all purpose side with zippered compartments. I use this bag for work, as well as for travel. If you wear the shoes you want to take, you can easily fit a weeks worth of clothing and toiletries in this bag.
review.name: Best all purpose bag I’ve found

review.reviewBody: Took this on a 3 week trip to Europe and it was perfect! Side pocket worked great for my passport and any other quick access items. Split design was great for adventures between locations, and since it's a Gregory, you know the comfort was spot on! The one downside is the sleeve for a water bottle...it's GIANT! My 32oz Hydroflask slid right out unless it was clipped in. Aside from that though, this pack is coming with on every trip!
review.name: Absolute best travel bag!

review.reviewBody: Great travel bag for weekend/carry on. Zippers can tend to be slightly annoying at times but overall great bag.
review.name: Great Travel Bag

review.reviewBody: I was able to pack for a 14 day trip in Italy with this backpack and a small duffel.

I really enjoy this bag because of the size, fit and color. My favorite part is that I can keep my dirty clothes separate from my clean clothes. I do wish that it had a waist band like the larger bags because it is so versatile and can store much more than similar bags from different brands. I also like that it opens up and splits in half so I can see everything at once. It makes it easy for organization.
review.name: Great bag for travel

review.reviewBody: I thought I wanted the 40L but am happy with the 30L. 30L is still a little big under airline seat but I make it work if not totally full.  Great for a 2 week Europe trip with a roller carry on. I'm usually a duffel person but this is my new go to travel combo.
review.name: Go to travel bag.

name: Border Traveler 30L Backpack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Passive Lock Strap online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I haven't put it to actual use yet but I have examined it closely. It will work as advertised, of this I have no doubt. I own a camera strap that has similar functionality (Steel cables inside) and it has saved my camera at least twice
review.name: Very easy to use, Secure

review.reviewBody: Strap in trunk seems way too long.  Looks like it could be cut easily but hopefully would deter someone from attempting to steal bike rack.
review.name: Deterrent
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule Passive Lock Strap. 
Your assessment of the strap being a deterrent is exactly correct. Locking systems create an additional obstacle between would-be thieves and your bike. The Thule Passive Lock strap makes it more difficult to remove a trunk-mounted bike rack from the vehicle. The long strap ensures it is able to reach into the trunk of most vehicles from where it wraps around the bike rack. 
Dedicated thieves with the right tools and enough time can circumvent most security measures. The best way to protect your bike and bike rack is remove it when not in use and ensure it is not left unattended for long periods of time.

review.reviewBody: It is not really a "lock" per se, but the plastic "puck" attached to the end makes sure that the trunk has to be opened to remove the strap from the rack. The rack is effectively attached to the car via the strap in the locked trunk.
review.name: Does what it is suppose to do

review.reviewBody: Smart idea, great & durable design, easy to use, reasonable price, high quality workmanship
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: I bought this a few weeks ago.  It's inexpensive and easy to install.   You wrap one end on the bike rack & close the other end on the truck..... that's it.  Great security for the bike rack
review.name: Passive lock strap

review.reviewBody: I am content with the new straps I  purchased however I appreciate changing the color from black to blue. I much prefer the color black because it hid the scuff marks while the blue shows the scuff marks. So change for change sake.
review.name: The color of the straps

name: Passive Lock Strap

review.reviewBody: I've had really good experiences with 7mesh thus far - this one is no exception.  feels great, looks good.  lots of good storage options on the back.  was a little more than I wanted to spend on a jersey, but sometimes it's better to just pay for quality and love using it.  In fact, I ended up buying a second one in a different color.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: I love everything 7Mesh makes and the Horizon is ultra comfortable.  Perfect for warm days, up to low-80's and works great if you are starting off in the 60's.   The fabric is a very fine waffle texture that is soft and wicks incredibly well.  It has been durable (I ride gravel) while holding its shape over time.  Excellent fit and finish.   Overall fit is athletic but, order according to the chart.  it seemingly conforms to your body but doesnt feel suffocating.  Im 5' 11", 168 and wear medium where I typically wear large in Rapha. Excellent rear pockets.  For cooler temps I wear the 7Mesh Ashlu.
review.name: Outstanding warm weather Jersey

name: Horizon Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: I was looking at racks for my Cannondale Topstone. I did not want to rely on integrated frame bosses, thru axles or anchoring to the seatpost. The Aeroe rack popped up in my searches and ended up being a perfect find. I recently took this on a 350 mile gravel adventure and it was absolutely bullet proof. Did not move, no issues. Handled 2x 12L pannier bags and top waterproof bag extremely well. It withstood mud, rain, rough trails like a champ.
review.name: Fantastic, versatile rack

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a wider style spd cycling shoe that works well both on and off the bike. These fit that need. I like the style and the boa system. Had to order a size up from my normal size for the best fit (normally Euro 39, purchased Euro 40).
review.name: Happy with Purchase

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these shorts! I have the Sandshell and Vintage Indigo. I purchased my first pair early in the summer, and bought them in another color a few weeks later. The crotch length is a bit awkwardly long, but the overall fit is still great. They're comfortable and true to size, and such a cute length. Love the pocket detail on them!
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: They look and feel really nice. Until I put them on. They sit 2inch under my bust. At least the inseam is actually about 5inches
review.name: Nice material, but really weird fit

review.reviewBody: These are super cute! They are just a tad… awkward? They are extremely high waisted, yet longer than expected on the legs. Otherwise, I’d say they do run true to size. They are very flexible and comfy.
review.name: Cute, but awkward

review.reviewBody: I will keep these shorts BUT the excessive fabric in the crotch makes them weird. I too like the other details like the cute seams and the ribbon on the pocket.  If you are buying these, know that the first is off, the hips and the crotch do not land well on the body.
review.name: The crotch is an issue

review.reviewBody: Odd fit, loose around belly. Gave them away
review.name: Workwear shorts womens

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased these shorts in the coconut shell color, and overall, I am pleased enough with my purchase to not return the shorts. The shorts boast a cute design, a true-to-size waist, and comfortable fit around the butt and thighs. However, there is one notable issue that does not fit well on my body type- the peculiar length of the crotch seam on the front. 

The crotch seam length is a bit perplexing. When I wear the shorts, the crotch seam extends far beyond the end of my crotch, which creates a slightly unflattering and awkward look. The excessive fabric in the front becomes more apparent when I sit down. 

Despite this quirk, I have decided to keep the shorts as I appreciate other cute and comfortable features they offer. The terracotta color is not too bright but not too dull. The length is not too short. The length is actually on the longer end, but they still look cute rolled up. I love the unique design patch on the back pocket, and I love the thick and durable, yet breathable and comfortable, fabric.

If not for the strange crotch seam, I would give these shorts a 10/10.
review.name: Cute Pocket, Durable Fabric, Long Crotch

name: Cotton Canvas Workwear Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: The vest is comfortable, lightweight and well ventilated. I spent a long day on the river fishing and rowing a pontoon boat.  The compact design clears the seat back so you can lean back into the seat without the vest being in the way and casting is easy.  The pockets and attachment points are handy.  I like it.
review.name: Outstanding

review.reviewBody: I'm 6' 170 lbs and the medium fits great. It is comfortable to wear all day and adjusts in enough places to make it fit over all kids of layers or no layers! Good in a boat seat too.
review.name: Love the pockets

review.reviewBody: Great fishing kayak life jacket.  Lots of pockets for storage and very roomy.  Unobstructed when paddling.
review.name: Great for Kayaking Fishing

review.reviewBody: The Astral V8 is perfect for kayak fishing! The fit is like a glove, while still allowing for great air flow. The streamlined design of the Astral PFD‚Äôs makes it easy to paddle, cast a fishing rod, or even get back on the kayak in the event of an unexpected swim. I‚Äôve used Astral products since 2014 and can attest to their quality firsthand. I wouldn‚Äôt be on the water without my Astral PFD.
review.name: Perfect PFD

review.reviewBody: After tons of research I finally settled on the Astral V-Eight Fisher.  I live in the southeast and primarily kayak during the summer months.  I wanted a vest that was comfortable during long days on the water and wouldn’t leave me sweating  all over.  This one has performed flawlessly over my 1 full season with it.  It’s in perfect shape even though it’s had some hard days on the water. I’m more than impressed so far.
review.name: Perfect Kayak Life Vest

review.reviewBody: This model adds breathability to the fishing PFD range.  The High Back design makes sitting in fishing kayaks a breeze and the tool organization is great.
review.name: V-Eight Fisher

name: V-Eight Fisher Personal Flotation Device

So, not a good choice if you have animals.

This is not the pant for you if you are short. I am 5 ft. They were too long. The inseam length was not listed on the website.
If you are tall you are in luck. They might be heavier than a running tight.
 They are very comfortable. I didn't test them in the outdoors.
I  might have bought them if they had shorter petite sizes.

review.name: So fast!

review.reviewBody: While my day to day training trail shoe is the Speedcross 5, this S-lab Ultra 3 is my go-to for days when I want to go fast, or long.  I have about 200 miles on them, and plan to wear them for another 100 before I buy a new pair.  They are as comfortable as you could hope for.  They are light.   They feel fast, almost like a racing shoe.  They have an awesome collar around the foot opening that prevents dirt, rocks, snow  from getting inside.  While not quite as protective, or as grippy, as the Speedcross 5, they have a decent rock plate and good enough protection that I don't need to be too careful about my footing.  If I could only have one shoe option, I would probably go with these.
review.name: Easily my favorite trail shoes ever

review.reviewBody: I barely use them - uppers perfect, some lugs at zero. Expected more as I'm serial salomon inc hiking boots.
review.name: Warning: The soles wear down horrificly fast!
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: Snug yet comfortable and precise. Best trail shoe I’ve owned.
review.name: The Trail Shoe

review.reviewBody: Had for three weeks, been on a few runs, exactly what I was hoping. Feels very firm, extremely stable. Most technically capable shoe I have ever owned. The sock like sleeve keeps the rocks out, which is nice. Always a fan of the lacing system. Perhaps just a little on the narrow side, but I have wide feet. Great for side hilling, as the heel cup is extremely secure.
review.name: What I hoped it would be

review.reviewBody: Ran an ultra marathon with this shoe. Switch it after I think 35-45 miles . I wish it was waterproof . Good stability . Bad in deep mud but it very deep deep mud.
review.name: Good shoe

review.reviewBody: Second pair, 50+ mile ultras on mixer terrain, performs phenomenally
review.name: Perfect Hybrid Shoe

review.reviewBody:
Hi there, I have been using the trainers regularly. First though I had to get the right size.
I am size 9 UK, and 43 EU. When I received the first pair I could not fit 1/3 of my foot into the shoe because of the tight entrance on the top of the shoe, so instead of going for half size bigger I went for a whole one. The size 10 is just ok but it feels long and a little loose now that have used them a few times. Should have gone for 9.5. Unfortunately the only way to find out properly  is to use the shoes. I believe  the system with no shoe lace is the reason that makes the process of choosing the right size difficult; as you have to struggle to put them on , even using a shoe horn, but then you have to allow for some softening after a few runs.So now I make do with them,  but they are not as perfect as they should be especially for the price tag.
review.name: Size trouble

review.reviewBody: Finally no little rocks and other derbies inside my shoes. That's just brilliant!!!
review.name: Confortable out of the box

review.reviewBody: These trail runners are a great balance of underfoot protection, grip, and light weight. Required zero break-in, resulted in zero blisters. Can't ask for more.
review.name: Your Feet Will Thank You

review.reviewBody: SRAM confirmed the claimed weight of the 160mm version should be 117g, not 102g. Competitive Cyclist is incorrectly quoting the weights for the 6 bolt version on the page with the centerlock version.
review.name: Weight listed incorrectly
comment: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We’ve reached out to you via email to confirm and address the issue. We appreciate your feedback and patience as we work to resolve this.

review.reviewBody: works well, most important specs 160mm is 117grams and 140mm is 103 grams.
review.name: oh STOP it!

review.reviewBody: I use these on my Crux gravel bike, 180 front, 160 rear. They are light and work really well. They do make some pinging noises but it doesn't affect performance and they don't go out of true often. Overall they are great for my gravel bike.
review.name: Excellent Gravel Bike rotor

review.reviewBody: for the sale price it is great, works well for what is intended. Official weight for the 160mm is 117 grms.
review.name: good buy

review.reviewBody: It's a brake rotor.
review.name: classic SRAM stopper

review.reviewBody: Works fine, but is very prone to temperature related pinging noises.
review.name: Adequate

review.reviewBody: I bought a couple of the Centreline X 140mm CL rotors from CS because I was curious to learn how they are different compared to the "previous model" Centreline "2" 140mm rotors.  All I could find on the internet was that the Centreline X was "lighter" due to use of a newer alloy. Was unable to find official claimed weights for both the new and older model (found one but not the other).  They look identical, boxes are identical, box serial numbers slightly different, batch code engraved on the rotors the same. My jewellery scale indicated the old model weighs 103.20g and the "new" model 103.78g - essentially both weigh the same.  So I am none the wiser except to think either X and 2 are the same with a different marketing name or I was sold to identical rotors with two different model names.  Seems to me I have and weighed either two  "X" or two "2" 140mm rotors or "X" and "2" are different names for the same product.
review.name: Centreline X 140mm v  Centreline 2 140mm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was shocked at the cheap feel of the material used. It was surprisingly thin and plasticky-feeling. I know polyester is artificial but my fleece hoodie from LLL is very soft and thick in comparison. It's my fault for not reading the details closely, but when I saw that it was jersey-lined, I incorrectly assumed it was cotton, which would've been preferred. Had I known it was 100% polyester, I wouldn't have purchased it, however, it's my bad for not reading the fine details. In my opinion, the pricing for this quality should be around $50-75. I liked the generous cut/casual fit, tunic and arm length and hoodie but the material is very disappointing.
review.name: Poor quality but comfortable style

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the fit, the quarter zip, and the hood. I wear this in the office at work when it gets chilly. I wear this taking the dogs out when it's not cold enough to need a jacket. I have had many compliments on how comfortable it is.
review.name: Yes I plan of buying more in different colors

review.reviewBody: For my flat feet and Morton's neuroma, the M Clifton 9 GTX and Gaviota 5's provide the comfort and cushioning I need for the mile walk from Boston Garden to the office on brick sidewalks and uneven rocks through Quincy Marketplace and Faneuil Hall. Only negative with both is one sneaker fits perfectly and the other is slightly crowded. Left sneaker on Gaviota 5 and right sneaker on the M Clifton 9 GTX.
review.name: Extreme comfort and protection from soggy sock

review.reviewBody: I have been purchasing the Clifton line for a few years. The GTX Clifton 9 is a delight. Hoka comfort with protection from mother nature. Took my family to a carnival and it was a light rain in the forecast. The GTX stayed completely dry. New color has people turning their heads. I walk many miles. They are holding up great. I definitely reccomended these sneakers.
review.name: Comfortable With Weather Protection

review.reviewBody: I love the shoes. They are very comfortable and have perfect arch support. Very thick-soft sole for added comfort. The fit very well throughout except for a little excess room around the toes, something I only notice when running down-hill. I did try on a half size up and down to make sure this was my correct shoe size. It is only a minor discomfort which I do not always feel. Even with this small issue it is still one of the most comfortable running shoes I have ever purchased.
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: I'm not a running aficionado like most of the other runners, but I put in a couple miles a day. I have a pretty heavy tendency to pronate when I jog and these shoes really help with that when my mind starts to wander when I'm jogging. The cushion is incredible and my feet have stopped hurting after my runs. I haven't jogged in wet conditions yet, so I cannot speak on the quality of the gore-tex yet. Overall, these shoes are one of my best purchases ever. I will buy more when the time comes.
review.name: I've finally found my perfect shoes!

review.reviewBody: I've purchased (3) pairs of Clifton 9 shoes this year. (2) of which are GTX, because they don't make the all white in GTX. I can wear them to do yard work, wash them off, and then wear them out on errands. Best shoe I've ever worn.
review.name: 3rd Pair of Clifton 9 shoes in 2024

review.reviewBody: I had no idea Hokas were a community like Jeeps... Other Hoka owners keep coming up to me to compliment my shoes and make sure I see theirs too.
review.name: Super comfortable

review.reviewBody: I purchased this pair for my 13 year old Grandson. He loves everything about them! It would be nice however, to offer 1/2 sizes above 13. Thank you for a fantastic product!
review.name: 4th pair of Hoka!

review.reviewBody: I wear this for work. I do like the product. It's my 2nd Hoka. BUT, within a few weeks of buying this online the flap on the heel has come loose. How do I get a refund or replacement?
review.name: Within a few weeks the flap on the heel has come loose.

review.reviewBody: I work in a garden center. standing and walking for 9-10 hours a day, four seasons a year. these are phenomanal. right out of the box they're light and bouncy on concrete. waterproof and kept my socks dry from the hose/rain/ and snowing conditions . grip/tred wore down but still holds its "Hoka feel" on long days of standing/walking. thanks Hoka
review.name: DEF WILL BUY ANOTHER PAIR

review.reviewBody: The best most comfotable shoe on the market. This is my second pair of Clifton.
review.name: Great product. Will always buy the Clifton model.

name: Clifton 9 GTX Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Fits well. Comfortable on my kiddo and good quality. They last longer than other shoes that get holes in them after a month of wear!
review.name: Great shoes!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are super dangerous.  The "laces" stretch and now they touch the ground and flop around even when they are tucked in. They are a tripping hazard. We have bought a lot of Merrell shoes but these ones are awful. I bought the adult pair and had to return them for the same reason. My kids looked ok, but as time went on they got worse and worse. I do not recommend. These shoes have been worn for about 5 months but not exclusively. Maybe only 3 months in total. We purchased them over the summer for school but he preferred different pair. He outgrew the other pair and now I'm really seeing just how bad these are.
review.name: Dangerous

review.reviewBody: Great shoes, secure with no laces to tie! Highly recommend!
review.name: Excellent, easy to wear, great quality!

review.reviewBody: nice shoes for my son. Lightweight and easy to get on and off
review.name: lightweight hiker

review.reviewBody: As cool looking as these shoes are, they are impossible to get on and are too narrow.
review.name: Narrow, tight, very hard to get on

review.reviewBody: Nice shoe, great for everyday walking. My calfs don't hurt with these shoes.
review.name: Nice walking shoe fits comfortably

review.reviewBody:
These were a replacement for the Nova which used to be our go to shoe (side note: that shoe has changed and fell apart immediately). 
Kid reports these are comfy, wearing everyday. Very light weight and so far holding up to normal activities including light hiking.
review.name: New Favorite

review.reviewBody: My son wears this daily to school and it holds up well
review.name: Awesome everyday kids shoe
comment: Thank you for the great review!

name: Agility Peak Hiking Shoe - Girls'
